column4: with the latest update to Firefox, I can no longer enter in an address into the address bar, or the search bar and go to that page: it gives me an error.    Is this common?
The error is "ASSERT: Search: _installLocation: enghine has no file!"  and then it gives me a stack Trace, which I don't think will be relevant.
oh, and did you restart the browser completely after installing the upgrade?
I exed it out and then opened it up again....   I have a few, yes...
does it still fail with those off (or use the firefox safe mode)? Also consider pastebinning the stack trace
ah.... the clever little "downloads" box was hiding on another desktop of mine.... ha..... it'll probably work now.
MarkJones: err, does fglrx still support that card? If that's what I think it is it won't
roughly how old is that card?
I'm not really sure.  I got this laptop in a junk pile...
pretty sure you want the opensource radeon driver for that one, and that the closed-source fglrx driver from ati.amd.com doesn't even support it anymore
I just saw a random fglrx recommendation, I try to correct those if they're wrong :)
if the same video (same resolution, etc) plays when played from different hardware (not from a physical dvd) I can't see how the video driver's the problem
otoh I think you mentioned "vlc logs me out" earlier? how's that?
if that means the X server crashes that could be the driver's fault
I believe the X server crashed.  It closed all my open programs and brought me back to my login screen.
My X server crashed when I used dual monitors too....  Don't know exactly why..
